comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
This should cause `./bin/powershell -c "exit 2"` to return 2 as the exit code now.

@zach-folwick Is there any way we could spawn a second PowerShell process using Pester to test this?

comments.author: zach-folwick
comments.body:
from bash:

./bin/powershell -c "./bin/powershell -c "exit 2" $LASTEXITCODE " outputs `2` to the console.

in powershell:
PSL>   "exit 2" > testExitCode.ps1
PSL>   $LASTEXITCODE
PSL>   2

EDIT:  ./bin/powershell -c "exit 2"; echo $? from bash does produce 2.
